tasks.title: Production Desktop Builds (Mac + Windows + Linux)
tasks.context: electron-builder is installed (^24.9.1) and the build command exists in package.json, but there is NO platform-specific configuration. No code signing, no installer config, no auto-updater. Build resources exist at build/icon.png (512x512).

subtasks.title: Create electron-builder.json with platform targets
subtasks.context: Mac: DMG + universal binary (Intel + Apple Silicon). Windows: NSIS installer. Linux: AppImage (optional, lower priority). Configure app metadata, file associations, protocol handler (anthracite://).

subtasks.title: macOS code signing + notarization
subtasks.context: Requires Apple Developer account ($99/yr). Sign with Developer ID Application certificate. Notarize via notarytool. Without this, macOS will block the app with Gatekeeper.

subtasks.title: Windows Distribution: Publish to Microsoft Store
subtasks.context: Microsoft Store handles signing for free/cheap (~$19 once), avoiding the expensive EV cert ($400/yr). Requires packaging as MSIX. Users install via Store link or appinstaller.

subtasks.title: Configure electron-updater for auto-updates
subtasks.context: Use GitHub Releases as update server (free). electron-updater checks for new versions on app launch. Show update available notification in-app.

subtasks.title: Handle native module bundling (better-sqlite3)
subtasks.context: better-sqlite3 requires platform-specific .node binary. electron-rebuild is already configured (postinstall script). Verify it works in packaged builds on all platforms.

subtasks.title: Bundle Python backend with the Electron app
subtasks.context: Currently the Python backend (backend/) runs separately. For production: either bundle a Python runtime (PyInstaller/cx_Freeze the FastAPI server into a single binary) or require users to have Python installed. Bundling is strongly preferred for non-technical users. Alternative: rewrite backend in Node.js to eliminate Python dependency entirely.

subtasks.title: Test full install → launch → use → auto-update flow on Mac and Windows

tasks.title: CI/CD Pipeline — Automated Builds & Releases
tasks.context: No GitHub Actions workflows exist for desktop builds. Website deploys via Vercel (already configured). Need automated multi-platform builds triggered on git tags.

subtasks.title: Create .github/workflows/build.yml
subtasks.context: Matrix build: macos-latest (DMG), windows-latest (NSIS), ubuntu-latest (AppImage). Trigger on push to tags matching v*. Steps: checkout, setup Node, npm install, electron-rebuild, npm run build, upload artifacts.

subtasks.title: Store code signing secrets in GitHub Secrets
subtasks.context: Mac: APPLE_ID, APPLE_TEAM_ID, CSC_LINK (base64 .p12), CSC_KEY_PASSWORD. Windows: WIN_CSC_LINK, WIN_CSC_KEY_PASSWORD.

subtasks.title: Auto-publish to GitHub Releases on tag push
subtasks.context: Use electron-builder --publish always. Creates GitHub Release with platform artifacts attached.

subtasks.title: Add type-check and lint step before build
Cache node_modules and Electron binaries
subtasks.context: Use actions/cache for node_modules and ~/.cache/electron. Saves 2-3 min per build.

tasks.title: Website Waitlist Backend — Actually Save Signups
tasks.context: The signup form on anthracitebrowser.com (website/src/components/Signup.tsx) is purely cosmetic. It shows 'You're on the list' but saves nothing — no API call, no database, no email service. Need a real backend to collect and manage waitlist signups.

subtasks.title: Choose and set up waitlist backend
subtasks.context: Options ranked by simplicity: (1) Vercel serverless function + Supabase table — free tier covers early stage, (2) Resend audience API — email-native, good for later sending launch emails, (3) Google Sheets API — quick and dirty. Recommended: Supabase for the table + Resend for confirmation emails.

subtasks.title: Create API endpoint for signup submission
subtasks.context: POST /api/signup accepting { name, email, role }. Validate email format. Check for duplicates. Return success/error.

subtasks.title: Connect Signup.tsx to the real API
subtasks.context: Replace the cosmetic setSubmitted(true) in handleSubmit with an actual fetch() to the API. Handle loading state, errors, duplicate emails gracefully.

subtasks.title: Send confirmation email on signup (optional)
subtasks.context: Use Resend or similar. Simple email: 'Thanks for signing up for Anthracite. We'll notify you when it's ready.'

subtasks.title: Create admin view or export for signups
subtasks.context: At minimum: ability to export CSV of all signups. Supabase dashboard gives this for free.

tasks.title: Fork & Customize browser-use for Anthracite
tasks.context: Currently using vanilla browser-use as a pip dependency (backend/requirements.txt). The agent works but is not significantly better than what anyone could build with browser-use + ChatGPT. To justify a paid tier and differentiate from open-source alternatives, the agent needs to be substantially more reliable, faster, and capable. This is THE core differentiator.

subtasks.title: Fork browser-use repo
subtasks.context: Fork to your own repo (e.g. anthracite-agent). Update backend/requirements.txt to install from the fork. Keep ability to pull upstream improvements.

subtasks.title: Study browser-use internals deeply
subtasks.context: Understand: how it takes screenshots, parses DOM, builds the accessibility tree, decides actions, handles errors, manages state between steps. Read the Agent class, BrowserSession, and all action handlers.

subtasks.title: Identify and fix reliability bottlenecks
subtasks.context: Common failures: clicking wrong element, getting stuck in loops, failing on dynamic content (SPAs), struggling with dropdowns/date pickers, losing context in multi-step tasks. Log and categorize agent failures to prioritize fixes.

subtasks.title: Improve DOM element targeting
subtasks.context: Combine: accessibility tree (primary) + CSS selectors + visual coordinates from screenshots. Current browser-use relies heavily on one method. Fallback chain makes targeting much more robust.

subtasks.title: Add task memory to prevent loops
subtasks.context: Agent should track what it's already tried in the current task. If it's clicking the same element 3 times with no state change, try a different approach. Implement a simple action history with 'already tried' detection.

subtasks.title: Optimize token usage / cost per task
subtasks.context: Current agent sends full screenshots + full DOM on every step. Optimize: use accessibility tree as primary input (much smaller), only send screenshots when visual context is needed (use_vision='auto' is a start but can be smarter). Reduce cost per task to make paid tier margins viable.

subtasks.title: Build two-tier agent: quick mode vs deep mode
subtasks.context: Quick mode: minimal DOM snapshot, no screenshot, fast LLM call — for simple actions. Deep mode: full browser-use pipeline with vision — for complex multi-step tasks. Classifier (backend/classifier.py) already routes simple vs complex; extend this to control agent depth.

tasks.title: Google/OAuth Account Linking — Agent Auth
tasks.context: Users need to link accounts (Google, Microsoft, etc.) so the AI agent can act as them — log into Gmail, book flights on their airline account, manage their calendar. Currently the agent has NO auth context and cannot access any logged-in services. This is NOT traditional OAuth (we don't need API tokens) — the agent needs actual browser session cookies so it can navigate sites as the user.

subtasks.title: Design the auth persistence architecture
subtasks.context: When user logs into Google in a normal Anthracite tab, capture and persist the session cookies for google.com. Store them so they survive app restarts. Electron's session.defaultSession.cookies API can get/set cookies. The agent's CDP-connected BrowserView needs to share these cookies.

subtasks.title: Implement persistent cookie/session storage
subtasks.context: Electron sessions are ephemeral by default (persist: prefix helps but needs explicit setup). Use session.defaultSession.cookies.get/set to save critical auth cookies. Encrypt stored cookies at rest using Electron's safeStorage API.

subtasks.title: Share session state between user browsing and agent BrowserView
subtasks.context: Currently the agent uses a separate BrowserView (off-screen, connected via CDP). It needs the same session cookies as the user's normal browsing session. Either use the same Electron session partition, or copy cookies before agent task starts.

subtasks.title: Add 'Connected Accounts' section in Settings
subtasks.context: Show which services the agent has access to (based on stored sessions). E.g., 'Google — signed in as user@gmail.com', 'GitHub — signed in'. Allow user to disconnect (clear cookies for that domain).

subtasks.title: Handle session expiry detection and re-auth prompts
subtasks.context: Sessions expire. When the agent tries to act on a site and gets redirected to login, detect this and prompt the user: 'Your Google session has expired. Please sign in again.' Pause agent, let user sign in, then resume.

subtasks.title: Security: encrypt stored session data, never send externally
subtasks.context: Session cookies are extremely sensitive (they ARE the user's identity). Encrypt at rest using Electron safeStorage. Never transmit to any server. Never include in error reports. Clear on 'Sign Out' of Anthracite account.

tasks.title: Multi-Model Support & API Key Management UI
tasks.context: Currently hardcoded to OpenAI GPT-4o with API key in .env file. No way for users to configure this. Users need to: (1) bring their own API keys, (2) choose which model to use, (3) store keys securely. The CommandBar already shows 'GPT-4o' as static text (line 303) — this should be a working model selector.

subtasks.title: Add API Key settings page
subtasks.context: New section in SettingsPage.tsx (src/renderer/components/SettingsPage.tsx). Input fields for: OpenAI key, Anthropic key, Google AI key. Validate on save (make a lightweight test call). Store securely using Electron's safeStorage API (NOT in a plain JSON file).

subtasks.title: Support multiple LLM providers in the backend
subtasks.context: Update backend/agent.py to accept provider + model + key as parameters instead of reading .env. Support: OpenAI (GPT-4o, GPT-4o-mini, o1), Anthropic (Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Claude 4), Google (Gemini). Use langchain's provider abstractions — already using langchain-openai.

subtasks.title: Make CommandBar model selector functional
subtasks.context: The 'GPT-4o' + ChevronDown button in CommandBar.tsx (line 299-305) is currently static. Make it a working dropdown showing available models (based on which API keys the user has configured). Persist last-used model choice.

subtasks.title: Support local models via Ollama
subtasks.context: For privacy-conscious users: detect if Ollama is running locally, list available models, route agent calls through Ollama. No API key needed. Lower quality but free and private.

tasks.title: User Authentication System
tasks.context: Currently zero auth exists in the desktop app. Everything is local. Need user accounts for: cloud sync, subscription management, cross-device continuity. This is a prerequisite for tasks 29 (sync) and 30 (payments).

subtasks.title: Choose auth provider
subtasks.context: Options: Clerk (best DX, generous free tier, handles OAuth flows), Supabase Auth (if already using Supabase for waitlist), Firebase Auth, or custom. Clerk recommended for speed and Electron compatibility.

subtasks.title: Implement sign-up / sign-in flow in Electron
subtasks.context: OAuth popup window (BrowserWindow) for Google/GitHub sign-in. Store auth tokens securely via Electron safeStorage. Show auth state in sidebar footer or settings.

subtasks.title: Support: email/password, Google OAuth, GitHub OAuth, Apple Sign-In
Add user profile section in Settings
subtasks.context: Show: avatar, name, email, plan tier, sign-out button. Link to subscription management.

subtasks.title: Handle offline mode gracefully
subtasks.context: App must work fully without auth — just without sync/cloud/subscription features. Never block the browser because of auth issues.

tasks.title: Cloud Sync — Realms, Docks, History, Settings
tasks.context: All user data is currently local only. Realms/Docks in anthracite-realms.json, history in SQLite (history.db), settings in settings.json. Authenticated users should be able to sync across devices. Depends on task 28 (user auth).

subtasks.title: Design sync architecture
subtasks.context: Options: (1) CRDTs for conflict-free merging (complex but robust), (2) Last-write-wins per entity (simpler, occasional data loss), (3) Manual merge on conflict (user decides). Start with last-write-wins for settings, CRDTs for realms/docks. Backend: Supabase Postgres + realtime subscriptions.

subtasks.title: Implement settings sync (simplest — start here)
subtasks.context: Settings are a single JSON blob. On change: upload to cloud. On login from new device: merge with local (cloud wins for most fields). Files: src/main/settings.ts.

subtasks.title: Implement realms & docks sync
subtasks.context: More complex — realms contain docks which contain tabs. Need entity-level sync, not whole-file replacement. Files: src/main/store.ts.

subtasks.title: Implement history sync
subtasks.context: SQLite history.db. Sync recent entries (last 30 days). Don't sync entire history — too large. Files: src/main/history.ts.

subtasks.title: Handle offline → online reconciliation
subtasks.context: Queue changes made while offline. Sync when connection restored. Handle conflicts.

tasks.title: Subscription & Payment System
tasks.context: Monetization layer. Business model: Free tier (bring your own API key, full browser features) + Pro tier (monthly subscription with agent credits — no API key needed, Anthracite proxies LLM calls). The agent must be significantly better than open-source alternatives for people to pay. Depends on tasks 25 (agent improvements) and 28 (user auth).

subtasks.title: Integrate payment provider
subtasks.context: Options: Stripe (industry standard, complex tax handling), Paddle (handles international tax/VAT automatically, simpler for solo dev). Paddle recommended for simpler setup. LemonSqueezy is another option.

subtasks.title: Design pricing tiers
subtasks.context: Free: BYOK (bring your own API key), all browser features, local agent. Pro ($X/month): N agent credits (each credit = 1 agent task), Anthracite's API proxy (no key needed), priority support, cloud sync. Team: future (shared realms, admin controls).

subtasks.title: Build API proxy server for paid users
subtasks.context: Paid users' agent calls route through Anthracite's backend using our API keys. This backend meters usage, enforces rate limits, and bills per credit. Tech: serverless functions or a lightweight API on Railway/Fly.io. Keys stored server-side, never sent to client.

subtasks.title: Implement credit/usage tracking
subtasks.context: Track: number of agent tasks run, tokens consumed, cost per task. Show usage in Settings: 'You've used 47 of 200 credits this month.' Warn at 80% and 100% usage.

subtasks.title: Add subscription management in Settings
subtasks.context: Show: current plan, usage bar, billing cycle, upgrade/downgrade button (opens Stripe/Paddle portal), payment history.

subtasks.title: Handle edge cases: payment failures, grace periods, downgrades
subtasks.context: On payment failure: 3-day grace period, then downgrade to free. On downgrade: keep all data, just disable proxy access. Never delete user data because of billing.

subtasks.title: In-app upgrade prompts (tasteful, not aggressive)
subtasks.context: When free user without API key tries to run agent: show a subtle prompt explaining they need either their own key or a Pro subscription. Never block normal browsing. Never nag.

tasks.title: Agent Task History & Saved Workflows
tasks.context: The agent has no memory between tasks. It should remember past interactions, learn user preferences, and allow saving repeatable workflows. This makes the agent feel intelligent rather than stateless.

subtasks.title: Store agent task history
subtasks.context: For each agent run, save: user instruction, classified intent, steps taken (actions + screenshots), success/failure, duration, model used, tokens consumed. Store in SQLite alongside browsing history.

subtasks.title: Add 'Task History' view in the UI
subtasks.context: New section accessible from sidebar or settings. Show past agent runs with step-by-step replay. Click a past task to see what the agent did. Option to re-run a task.

subtasks.title: Implement agent context memory
subtasks.context: Agent should know: user's name, frequently visited sites, preferred services (Gmail vs Outlook, Google Flights vs Kayak), past task patterns. Build a lightweight user profile the agent references on each run.

subtasks.title: Saved workflows — repeatable multi-step agent tasks
subtasks.context: Allow users to save an agent task as a 'workflow' (e.g., 'Check my email and summarize unread', 'Search for flights to X on Y date'). Show saved workflows in CommandBar or sidebar for one-click re-run.

tasks.title: Agent Reliability — Edge Cases & Failure Handling
tasks.context: Common scenarios where the agent breaks or gets stuck. Fixing these is critical for user trust and the paid tier value proposition.

subtasks.title: CAPTCHA handling — detect and defer to user
subtasks.context: When agent encounters a CAPTCHA: pause agent, show the page to the user, prompt them to solve it, then resume agent automatically after CAPTCHA is cleared.

subtasks.title: Handle popups, cookie banners, overlay modals
subtasks.context: These block element interaction. Agent should detect common patterns (cookie consent, newsletter popups, paywall modals) and dismiss them before attempting the actual task.

subtasks.title: Handle iframes and shadow DOM
subtasks.context: Many sites use iframes (e.g., payment forms, embedded content) and shadow DOM (web components). The agent's DOM parser needs to traverse into these.

subtasks.title: Handle file downloads and uploads
subtasks.context: Agent may trigger downloads (PDFs, CSVs) or need to upload files (forms, attachments). Integrate with Electron's download manager and file dialog.

subtasks.title: Improve form filling — dropdowns, date pickers, multi-step forms
subtasks.context: These are the most common agent failures. Custom dropdown components (not native <select>) are especially hard. Date pickers vary wildly across sites.

subtasks.title: Timeout handling — don't spin forever
subtasks.context: Add per-step timeouts (30s default) and per-task timeouts (5min default). If stuck, try alternative approach or ask user for help. Never leave agent running silently.

subtasks.title: Handle new tab/window creation during agent tasks
subtasks.context: Some sites open links in new tabs. Agent needs to follow into the new tab, complete the action, and return. Currently handled partially in main.ts setWindowOpenHandler but not integrated with agent flow.

tasks.title: Error Reporting & Crash Recovery
tasks.context: No error reporting or crash recovery exists. No visibility into what breaks for users in the wild.

subtasks.title: Integrate Sentry for Electron main + renderer crashes
Add Python backend error reporting
subtasks.context: Catch uncaught exceptions in agent runs. Report to Sentry with task context (instruction, model, step count).

subtasks.title: Implement crash recovery — restore tabs/realms on restart
subtasks.context: On app crash, save current state. On next launch, detect crash and offer to restore previous session.

subtasks.title: Add 'Report a Problem' in help menu / settings

tasks.title: Chrome Data Import & First-Run Experience
tasks.context: Users switching from Chrome/Brave/Edge need to import data. Critical for reducing switching friction. No import functionality exists.

subtasks.title: Import bookmarks → map to Anthracite Realms/Docks
subtasks.context: Chrome bookmarks are folders. Map top-level folders to Realms, sub-folders to Docks, bookmarks to pinned tabs or dock items.

subtasks.title: Import browsing history into SQLite
Import saved passwords (optional, offer to skip)
subtasks.context: Sensitive. Store in OS keychain if imported. Many users may prefer to skip and use a password manager.

subtasks.title: First-run import wizard on initial launch
subtasks.context: Detect installed browsers, offer to import. Clean, minimal UI matching Anthracite aesthetic. Steps: Welcome → Import → API Key Setup → Done.

subtasks.title: Support Chrome, Brave, Edge, Firefox, Safari

tasks.title: Keyboard Shortcuts & Command Palette
tasks.context: Some shortcuts exist (Cmd+R, Cmd+Shift+K for realm search) but there's no command palette and no customization.

subtasks.title: Add Cmd+K / Ctrl+K command palette for all browser actions
Add tab quick-switch with fuzzy search
Document and audit all existing shortcuts
Add customizable keybindings in settings

tasks.title: Testing Infrastructure
tasks.context: Zero tests exist in the project. No test framework configured. Need at minimum unit tests for core logic and E2E tests for critical user flows.

subtasks.title: Set up Vitest for unit tests
Write unit tests for core modules: history.ts, store.ts, settings.ts, classifier.py
Set up Playwright for Electron E2E tests
Write E2E tests: app launch, tab management, navigation, agent task execution
Run tests in CI (GitHub Actions)

tasks.title: Mobile Browser (Later Stage — iOS & Android)
tasks.context: Separate project from the Electron desktop app. Do NOT start until desktop is stable and monetized. Major architectural decisions needed — mobile can't run Python locally, so agent tasks must go through a cloud backend. iOS requires WebKit (Apple policy). Android allows custom engines.

subtasks.title: Research & architecture planning
subtasks.context: Options: React Native + WebView, native Swift (iOS) + Kotlin (Android), or a hybrid. Determine which features carry over. Design mobile-specific UI (bottom nav, gesture-based tab switching). Plan cloud-based agent infrastructure.

subtasks.title: Build iOS app
subtasks.context: Must use WKWebView (Apple policy). Swift recommended for best performance and App Store compliance.

subtasks.title: Build Android app
subtasks.context: Can use custom Chromium or standard WebView. Kotlin recommended.

subtasks.title: Cloud-based agent backend for mobile
subtasks.context: Mobile devices can't run the Python agent locally. Build a cloud API that runs browser-use tasks on server-side browsers. This is also the infrastructure needed for the paid proxy tier (task 30).

subtasks.title: App Store & Play Store submission

tasks.context: Expand the native Electron menu to include standard browser features (File, Edit, View, History, Window, Help). Add keyboard shortcuts for common actions.
